featured.text: Although Russia does not occupy first place when it comes to alcohol consumption per capita, it is still close to the top.
During World War II, Norway was occupied by the Nazis.
The prickly pear cactus is such a powerful symbol in Mexico that it occupies a prime spot on Mexico’s national flag.

other.text: Which of the following is closest in meaning to “arid” in the first paragraph? (A) Occupied.
In the 1950s, flip-flops became popular in the United States as soldiers returning from occupied Japan brought zōris home.
One of these stories 32 the cookie’s origin back to 13th- and 14th-century China, which was then occupied by the Mongols.

definition.zh_def: 佔據；佔用（空間、時間或職位）
definition.en_def: To take up space, time, or a position.
definition.example: The children occupy the playground every afternoon.
